metadata.title: CVE-2024-36975 linux
metadata.description: In the Linux kernel, the following vulnerability has been resolved:  KEYS: trusted: Do not use WARN when encode fails  When asn1_encode_sequence() fails, WARN is not the correct solution.  1. asn1_encode_sequence() is not an internal function (located    in lib/asn1_encode.c). 2. Location is known, which makes the stack trace useless. 3. Results a crash if panic_on_warn is set.  It is also noteworthy that the use of WARN is undocumented, and it should be avoided unless there is a carefully considered rationale to use it.  Replace WARN with pr_err, and print the return value instead, which is only useful piece of information.
